Title: Software Engineer & Team Leader
Summary:
Software engineering and architecture for high load applications. Team direction and management for small agile
software teams. Design of engaging and responsive systems is a goal and a joy.

Experience.Title: Director of Software Development
Experience.Summary:
Managed and helped a team design and release several iterations of product website, and its administrative websites.
Helped team members with HR and career goals, as well as trouble shooting any technical problems. Comfortable with
new technologies and constantly challenging my team to learn and excel in their strengths. Designing next generation
cloud systems for high load and high availability sites for public facing as well as internally. Designing and maintain
product with sales, marketing, and executive input.

Experience.Title: Sr. Software Engineer
Experience.Summary:
Participated in the design and production of RiteTrack 5 and its modular composite framework. Designed and tested
production modules for RiteTrack 5. Designed and created a package management system for the RteTrack 5 modular
framework. Projected and estimated delivery of new components to production teams.

Experience.Title: Owner
Experience.Summary: Designed and created projects for various companies. We delivered custom websites as well as desktop applications. Managed the communication between the client and subcontractors.

Experience.Title: Software Engineer
Experience.Summary: Maintained an internal website for the University of Wyoming School of Education that managed all of their students and student teacher placements.

Experience.Title: Tower Crew Foreman / Radio Frequency Engineer
Experience.Summary: Planned and executed tower construction for large companies requiring a field area network (e.g. Oil Companies). Was responsible for an 8 man tower crew and the designs of the tower riggings and tower placement in relation the end point units.

Experience.Title: Tower Crew
Experience.Summary: Maintained equipment and installed new equipment on towers.

Experience.Title: Aviation Ordnance Man 3rd Class
Experience.Summary: Inspect, maintains and repair aircraft mechanical and electrical armament/ordnance systems; Service aircraft guns and accessories; Stow, assembles and load aviation ammunition including aerial mines, torpedoes, missiles and rockets; Service bomb, missile and rocket releasing and launching devices; Load supplementary munitions; Assemble, tests and maintain air-launched guided missiles; Supervise operation of aviation ordnance shops, armories and stowage facilities; Working Environment
